perturbation.original_text:
Article III. Outsourced Work

Outsourced work regarding this Contract is stated below: Part I: Establishment of Architectural Development Plan and Business Plan I. Establishment of documents and drawing relevant to the Architectural Development Plan and Business Plan II. Attendance of Concerned Work Coordination Meeting 1. Attendance of relevant review meetings and presentations 2. Reply to relevant consultations and revision of the development plan Part II: Development of Soil and Water Conservation Plan I. Establishment of documents and drawing relevant to the soil and water conservation plan. 1. Trunk sewer, calculation on water control and treatment and relevant design drawings. 2. Design of disasters prevention facilities during construction. 3. Design of desilting and detention basin. 4. Designs and drawings relevant to soil and water conservation. II. Attendance of Concerned Work Coordination Meeting 1. Attendance of review meetings and presentations 2. Reply to relevant consultations and revision of scheme drawings associated with soil and water conservation.
perturbation.changed_text:
Article III. Outsourced Work

Outsourced work regarding this Contract is stated below: Part I: Establishment of Architectural Development Plan and Business Plan I. Establishment of documents and drawing relevant to the Architectural Development Plan and Business Plan II. Attendance of Concerned Work Coordination Meeting 1. Attendance of relevant review meetings and presentations 2. Reply to relevant consultations and revision of the development plan Part II: Development of Soil and Water Management Plan I. Establishment of documents and drawing relevant to the soil and water conservation plan. 1. Trunk sewer, calculation on water control and treatment and relevant design drawings. 2. Design of disasters prevention facilities during construction. 3. Design of desilting and detention basin. 4. Designs and drawings relevant to soil and water conservation. II. Attendance of Concerned Work Coordination Meeting 1. Attendance of review meetings and presentations 2. Reply to relevant consultations and revision of scheme drawings associated with soil and water conservation.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Soil and Water Conservation Plan' to 'Soil and Water Management Plan' introduces ambiguity. While seemingly similar, 'conservation' has specific regulatory definitions related to environmental protection and resource management. 'Management' is broader and lacks the same legal weight, potentially leading to disputes about the required level of environmental stewardship.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Relevant environmental protection laws regarding soil and water conservation, which often have specific requirements tied to the term 'conservation'.

perturbation.original_text:
Article IV. Service Fee

The fees for services mentioned in Part I to Part VI are NTD 12 million ((SAY TWELVE MILLION ONLY) in total and the fees for planning and design of the buildings and construction monitoring shall be calculated based on the ratio of 3.50% of the legal construction cost hereof. Should Party A require a comprehensive modification on the development plan of the project outsourced and any subsequent extra cost occur in Party B; Party A shall bear the corresponding extra service fee.
perturbation.changed_text:
Article IV. Service Fee

The fees for services mentioned in Part I to Part VI are NTD 12 million ((SAY TWELVE MILLION ONLY) in total and the fees for planning and design of the buildings and construction monitoring shall be calculated based on the ratio of 3.50% of the standard construction cost hereof. Should Party A require a comprehensive modification on the development plan of the project outsourced and any subsequent extra cost occur in Party B; Party A shall bear the corresponding extra service fee.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'legal construction cost' to 'standard construction cost' creates a legal contradiction. 'Legal construction cost' likely refers to a cost defined by regulations for tax or permitting purposes. 'Standard construction cost' is vague and subjective, making the fee calculation unclear and potentially unenforceable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Construction cost regulations relevant to the project's jurisdiction that define 'legal construction cost'.

perturbation.original_text:
Article XI. Disputes Resolving

Both parties herein agree to resolve any dispute regarding interpretation of the Contract in the following methods: I. Should both Parties be unable to reach an agreement within one month through negotiation, they may apply for an arbitration in Miaoli County and the arbitration result shall be compulsory. II. Should either Party herein initiate a legal proceeding for revoking any arbitration result regarding the Contract, both Parties herein agree to take the Miaoli District Court of Taiwan as the competent court of first instance pursuant to the laws of the R.O.C..
perturbation.changed_text:
Article XI. Disputes Resolving

Both parties herein agree to resolve any dispute regarding interpretation of the Contract in the following methods: I. Should both Parties be unable to reach an agreement within one month through negotiation, they may apply for an informal mediation in Miaoli County and the mediation result shall be non-binding. II. Should either Party herein initiate a legal proceeding for revoking any informal mediation result regarding the Contract, both Parties herein agree to take the Miaoli District Court of Taiwan as the competent court of first instance pursuant to the laws of the R.O.C..
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'arbitration' to 'informal mediation' fundamentally alters the dispute resolution process. Arbitration results are typically binding and enforceable, while mediation results are usually non-binding and rely on voluntary agreement. This change undermines the enforceability of the dispute resolution clause.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Laws governing arbitration and mediation processes in Taiwan (R.O.C.), specifically those related to the enforceability of arbitration agreements.
